page.title: 15MR. DUNSTAN LOCK-KEEPER
page.content: At Old Windsor lock Mr. Dunstan has been lock-keeper for 12 months and was at Abingdon Lock before that for 10 years.He works all year round from 9.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m.and has an assistant and a relief worker in busy Summer months.He keeps a written record of all boats going through the lock;he advises on the river code and answers queries about the river.He will loan books about the Thames and its locks to interested school children. His hobbies are gardening, boating and looking after two Dobermann Pinchers who are pets.The wet Spring of 1985 caused a drop in river traffic through the lock: NUMBER OF BOATS THROUGH LOCK IN 1985 January 76 April 1831 February 46 May 3353 March 288 June 3518 by Alexander
